snippet: The beleaguered judge in New York City’s stop-and-frisk litigation rightly challenged an appellate court’s decision to remove her from overseeing the case.
abstract: Editorial criticizes appeals court decision to stay remedies ordered by Federal Judge Shira Scheindlin to correct the civil rights violations associated with New York City's stop-and-frisk policy; notes court also unjustly damaged Scheindlin's reputation when it removed her from case; supports motion filed by Scheindlin's lawyers that seeks to have her removal vacated.
lead_paragraph: The beleaguered judge in New York City’s stop-and-frisk litigation rightly challenged an appellate court’s decision to remove her from overseeing the case.
